definition: to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
separated in life and death/to part for ever

sentences.english: I'd never leave you until I die.
The doctor who had been used to see separation and death burst into tears at that moment.
sentences.chinese: 看慣了生離死別的醫生，卻在這一刻落淚了。

sentences.english: Love is like this , so is long or forever parting .
sentences.chinese: 愛情如是，生死別離如是。

sentences.english: The most unbearable pain in the world is to be parted in life, and separated by death.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最令人悲痛難忍的，莫過於生離和死別。

sentences.english: Neither shall there be sorrow or dying.
sentences.chinese: 也不再有悲傷和生離死別。

sentences.english: In a world without future, each parting of friends is a death.
sentences.chinese: 在沒有未來的世界裏，生離即死別。

sentences.english: How many people die from other health.

definition: separated in life and death/to part for ever
joys and sorrows/partings and reunions/the vicissitudes of life
after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
seriously ill and about to die
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
